result.execSummary:
The defendant Sherry Lee Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The costs shall be paid at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning August 1, 2016.

The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.  The jail sentence shall begin no later than September 1, 2016 at 4:30 pm.    The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order
In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing

Defendant Sherry Lee Davis in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea of no contest  to Count 1 and  plea of no contest 16TR221 - OWI  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in count 2.  Court dismisses Case No. 16TR267.   Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 - Possession of THC and  Case No. 16TR221 - OWI  - 346.63(1)(a).  Statement by Attorney Nocco.  Case No. 16CM36 the court orders court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; 10 days county jail with huber and good time to begin no later than September 1, 2016 at 4:30 pm.  Two days of sentence credit.   16TR221 - court orders $1,000.00 forfeiture; 8 month revocation of driver's license; AODA; OWI victim impact panel; IID; $45.00 blood draw.  The forfeiture and costs are to be paid at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning August 1, 2016.  - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 1, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Sherry Lee Davis in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waive reading  of complaint, charges and penalties.  Plea of not guilty to all charges. Citations are tracking with complaint.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 01:15 pm. - rt

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with the booking procedures. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Initial Appearance on May 10, 2016 at 1:00 p.m.

DAR started at 3:35:05.  Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin by phone. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $1,000.00 signature bond with conditions of: booking; to not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.  DE makes statement. Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.  Initial appearance set for May 10, 2016 at 1:00 p.m. DAR stopped at 3:38:45. ba
